str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
